x543.Description: The scanner is disabled and can’t be used.
x543.Action: Enter the configuration menu, and re-enable the scanner module. Go to “840.xx service check” on page 2-66

x543.Description: The scanner is disabled and can’t be used.
x543.Action: This message is posted when the MFP PORs. Enter the configuration menu, and re-enable the scanner module. Go to “840.xx service check” on page 2-66

x543.Description: Image Pipeline
x543.Action: Image pipeline ASIC. Go to “CCD service check” on page 2-68. Also,Go to “Flatbed home position service check” on page 2-69.

x543.Description: Scanner Failure
x543.Action: Communication failure. Go to “CCD service check” on page 2-68

x543.Description: Scanner Failure
x543.Action: Carriage mechanical failure.Go to “Flatbed motor service check” on page 2-68

x543.Description: Scanner Failure
x543.Action: ADF mechanical failure. Go to “ADF paper jam service check” on page 2-71

x543.Description: Scanner Failure
x543.Action: Lamp failure. Go to “CCD service check” on page 2-68

x543.Description: Front scan module output level error
x543.Action: Go to “CCD service check” on page 2-68

x543.Description: Rear scan module output level error
Front scan module lamp level too low
x543.Action: Front Mono channel, Front Color channels, Front Red channel, Front Green channel, and/or Front Blue channel is detected to have low lamp level. Go to “CCD service check” on page 2-68

x543.Description: Rear scan module lamp level too low
x543.Action: Rear Mono channel, Rear Color channels, Rear Red channel, Rear Green channel, and/or Rear Blue channel is detected to have low lamp level. Go to “CCD service check” on page 2-68

x543.Description: Scanner Failure
x543.Action: CCD failure Go to “CCD service check” on page 2-68

x543.Description: Front scan module cable failure or SCC card failure
x543.Action: CCD channel failure. Check each channel(mono, R, G, B) for identical values indicating bad cable and/or SCC card. Excessive noise test for the dark data indicating some sort of CCD or analog electronics issue on that channel or channels. Go to “CCD service check” on page 2-68

x543.Description: Rear scan module cable failure or SCC card failure
x543.Action: CCD channel failure. Check each channel(mono, R, G, B) for identical values indicating bad cable and/or SCC card. Excessive noise test for the dark data indicating some sort of CCD or analog electronics issue on that channel or channels. Go to “CCD service check” on page 2-68

x543.Description: Cable / SCC Failure
x543.Action: Front scan module connector or cable failure Go to “CCD service check” on page 2-68

x543.Description: Cable / SCC Failure
x543.Action: Rear scan module connector or cable failure Go to “CCD service check” on page 2-68

x543.Description: Cable Failure
x543.Action: The connector cable is defective. Go to “CCD service check” on page 2-68.

x543.Description: Front calibration strip unusable
x543.Action: Go to “CCD service check” on page 2-68

x543.Description: Rear calibration strip unusable
Front calibration strip too far left
x543.Action: The font calibration strip is placed to high or to low. Go to “CCD service check” on page 2-68

x543.Description: Front calibration strip too far right
x543.Action: Go to “CCD service check” on page 2-68.

x543.Description: Front calibration strip has excessive skew
Front calibration strip has excessive bow
Front calibration strip has excessive dark area
x543.Action: Front excessive variability for Mono, Red, Green, or Blue. Go to “CCD service check” on page 2-68

x543.Description: Front magnification exceeds limits
x543.Action: Rear excessive variability for Mono, Red, Green, or Blue. Go to “CCD service check” on page 2-68

x543.Description: Modem Failure
x543.Action: The Configuration ID bit that describes the device’s modem doesn’t match the actual modem installed in the device.

x543.Description: Fax Storage
x543.Action: The amount of flash storage available on the device is too small. Note: The NAND Flash partition can shrink as bit failures cause blocks to be invalidated. Go to “Format Fax Storage” on page 3-34. If the issue is not fixed, replace the controller board. Go to “Controller board removal” on page 4-18.

x543.Description: Fax Storage
x543.Action: The devices’ flash partition is invalid or unavailable. Go to “Format Fax Storage” on page 3-34. If the issue is not fixed, replace the controller board. Go to “Controller board removal” on page 4-18.

x543.Description: Modem/Config ID Mismatch
x543.Action: A device doesn’t have a modem installed, even though its Configuration ID indicates that a modem should be present.

x543.Description: Modem/Config ID Mismatch
x543.Action: A device has a modem installed, but its Configuration ID indicates that a modem shouldn’t be present.

x543.Description: HD/Config ID Mismatch
x543.Action: A device doesn’t have a hard drive installed, even though its Configuration ID indicates that a hard drive should be present.

x543.Description: HD/Config ID Mismatch
x543.Action: A device has a hard drive installed, but its Configuration ID indicates that a hard drive shouldn’t be present.

x543.Description: Unrecoverable RIP software error/ illegal trap.
x543.Action: Go to “900.xx—System software error” on page 2-31.

x543.Description: A general engine software error.
x543.Action: Go to “90x.xx error (902.xx–907.xx)” on page 2-33

x543.Description: Board level was not obtained.
Timeout waiting for bullet serial data to be updated.
NVM_OK was not received from NV2 server for successfully submitted request.
Over temperature condition detected.
Main fan stalled
x543.Action: Go to “925.01—Fan error service check” on page 2-34

x543.Description: The printer doesn't register a transition on the toner sensor for a set period of time. Either the printer's toner sensor is faulty or its print cartridge is defective.
x543.Action: The Servicer should follow these steps to resolve this problem: 1. Use the base sensor test in Diagnostics mode to inspect the toner sensor's operation. 2. If the toner sensor is operating correctly, then the problem is the print cartridge.

x543.Description: Low voltage power supply did not detect zero crossing.
x543.Action: Replace the LVPS. See “Low-voltage power supply (LVPS) assembly” onpage 4-43.

x543.Description: The cyan cartridge toner meter cycle (TMC) switch error. .01 - Recoverable .02 - non recoverable
x543.Action: Go to “Toner sensors (Y, C, M, K) on TMC card” on page 2-61

x543.Description: The magenta cartridge toner meter cycle (TMC) switch error. .01 - Recoverable .02 - non recoverable
x543.Action: Go to “Toner sensors (Y, C, M, K) on TMC card” on page 2-61

x543.Description: The yellow cartridge toner meter cycle (TMC) switch error. .01 - Recoverable .02 - non recoverable
x543.Action: Go to “Toner sensors (Y, C, M, K) on TMC card” on page 2-61

x543.Description: The black cartridge toner meter cycle (TMC) switch error. .01 - Recoverable .02 - non recoverable
x543.Action: Go to “Toner sensors (Y, C, M, K) on TMC card” on page 2-61

x543.Description: The pel clock check failed.
x543.Action: If this error message persists, replace the controller board. See “Controller board removal” on page 4-18.

x543.Description: Delay line calibration failure
x543.Action: If this error message persists, replace the controller board. See “Controller board removal” on page 4-18.

x543.Description: There is a mismatch between controller EEPROM and mirror. • 950.00 through 950.29 codes: mismatch between controller and mirror • 950.30 through 950.60 codes: mismatch between secure and controller
x543.Action: Go to “950.xx NVRAM failure service check” on page 2-36.

x543.Description: Mismatch between controller EEPROM and mirror. • 951.00 through 951.29 codes: mismatch between controller and mirror • 951.30 through 951.60: mismatch between secure and controller
A recoverable MVRAM Cyclic
x543.Action: Performing a POR will clear this error.

x543.Description: Redundancy Check (CRC) error occurred. “n” is the offset at which the error occurred.
NVRAM chip failure with mirror.
The NVRAM chip failure with controller part.

The Code ROM or NAND flash failed the Cyclic Redundancy Check (CRC) check or the NAND experienced an uncorrectible multi-bit failure. “<loc>” indicates the source of the failure and has one of the following values: • CRC Failure: The source is a failing package indicated by Pnwhere “n” is the package number. This error could occur on a controller with ROM or NAND flash and could occur as a result of the CRC check done when the machine is powered on. The range of package numbers is from 0 to 15. • Error Correction Code (ECC)Failure: The source is a failing page indicated by Bn where “n” is the page number. This error occurs only if a multi-bit failure is detected during the ECC execution. Single bit failures will be corrected automatically and will not result in a service error. The range of page numbers is from 0 to 1023.
Controller board failure. Processor failure.
x543.Action: Replace conrtroller board. See“Controller board removal” on page 4-18.

x543.Description: Processor over temperature.
Controller board failure. ASIC failure.
Printer has performed more than 100 “shift and reflash” operations as a result of ECC bit corrections.
Controller verification failure of pensive boot code
x543.Action: Update firmware or replace controller board. See“Controller board removal” on page 4-18.

x543.Description: Failure to authenticate Signature Verification Code.
x543.Action: Update firmware or replace controller board. See“Controller board removal” on page 4-18.

x543.Description: Signature verification Code failure to authenticate a code partition.
x543.Action: Update firmware or replace controller board. See“Controller board removal” on page 4-18.

x543.Description: Jump to unverified address.
x543.Action: Update firmware or replace controller board. See“Controller board removal” on page 4-18.

x543.Description: Unknown Boot Failure.
x543.Action: Update firmware or replace controller board. See“Controller board removal” on page 4-18.

x543.Description: System hardware failure.
x543.Action: Replace controller board. See“Controller board removal” on page 4-18.

x543.Description: System did not respond to command request.
x543.Action: Replace controller board.

x543.Description: Challenge Secret Failure.
x543.Action: ASIC/SP mismatch Replace controller board. See“Controller board removal” on page 4-18.

x543.Description: System self test failure during initialization.
x543.Action: Replace controller board. See“Controller board removal” on page 4-18.

x543.Description: EEPROM Retention Error (write failure)
x543.Action: Replace controller board. See“Controller board removal” on page 4-18.

x543.Description: Insufficient device space during hardware programming.
x543.Action: Replace controller board. See“Controller board removal” on page 4-18.

x543.Description: Incremental counter reset exceeds maximum value.
x543.Action: Replace controller board. See“Controller board removal” on page 4-18.

x543.Description: Increment count failed due to maximum value limit.
x543.Action: Replace controller board. See“Controller board removal” on page 4-18.

x543.Description: Invalid SP memory configuration.
x543.Action: Replace controller board. See“Controller board removal” on page 4-18.

x543.Description: RAM memory error: RAM soldered on the board is bad.
x543.Action: Replace controller board. See“Controller board removal” on page 4-18.

x543.Description: RAM memory error: slot 1 RAM is bad.
x543.Action: Check RAM. If RAM is ok, replace the controller. See“Controller board removal” on page 4-18.

x543.Description: RAM memory error: slot 2 RAM is bad.
x543.Action: Check RAM. If RAM is ok, replace the controller. See“Controller board removal” on page 4-18.

x543.Description: Download emulation cyclic redundancy
x543.Action: The following actions may be taken:

x543.Description: check (CRC) failure has occurred. A checksum failure detected in the emulation header or emulation file.
x543.Action: 1. Disable the Download Emulation. 2. Program the download emulation into the code overlay SIMM again. 3. If the problem is not resolved replace the code overlay SIMM, and download emulation again.

x543.Error: 975.xx Service Standard Network or 975.xx Service Network Card x
x543.Description: Network error: unrecognizable network port.
x543.Action: Replace the standard network card or the card in the specified slot.

x543.Description: Unrecoverable software or error in
x543.Action: If unable to clear the error message, check

x543.Description: network or network port.
x543.Action: the following:
• If installed, check network card for
correct installation. • If correctly installed, replace the network card. • If a network card is not installed, replace the controller board.

x543.Description: Bad checksum while programming
x543.Action: Check the following:

x543.Description: network port.
x543.Action: • Make sure you have downloaded the
code in binary mode, not ASCII.
• Reprogram the Network card.

• If the problem persists, and if installed, check the network card for correct installation. • If correctly installed, replace the network card. If a network card is not installed, replace the controller board.

x543.Description: Flash parts failed while programming
x543.Action: Check the following:

x543.Description: the network port
x543.Action: • If installed, check the network card for
correct installation.
• If correctly installed, replace the network card. • If a network card is not installed, replace the controller board.

x543.Description: Communications error detected by the
specified device. Note: <device> can be one of the following: • Duplex unit •Tray 2 •Tray 3

This error message indicates that an equipment check condition has occurred in the specified device, but the device is unable to identify the exact component failure. Note: <device> can be one of the following: • Duplex option. •Tray2 •Tray 3
